events.message: The insured has reported an auto accident involving their vehicle on the morning of March 1st, providing initial details of the collision.
The claim was classified under Auto Accident after reviewing the description and keywords related to car damage and collision.
An experienced claims agent was assigned to handle the case promptly following the categorisation of the auto accident claim.
The insured was contacted to acknowledge receipt of the claim and to confirm that the processing has begun.
The claims team requested photographs of the vehicle damage and a copy of the police report related to the auto collision.
The insured submitted all requested documentation including photos of the car damage and the official police accident report.
The investigation into the collision circumstances and liability began, focusing on damage assessment and third-party involvement.
The investigation report was finalized, confirming the insured was not at fault and that the damages were consistent with the collision.
A settlement offer covering repair costs and rental car reimbursement was proposed to the insured following the investigation findings.
The insured expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciated the quick and clear communication throughout the process.
The claim was formally approved by the claims supervisor after review of the investigation and customer acceptance of the settlement.
Payment for the approved settlement was issued to the insured's specified account to cover all documented repair and associated costs.
Following payment confirmation, the auto accident claim was officially closed with no outstanding issues or additional queries from the customer.
The full file, including all documents and correspondence related to the auto accident claim, was archived for future reference if needed.
